name: <datalist> Element
summary: Shows a list of pre-defined options to suggest to the user when entering an input element.

name: <details>/<summary>
summary: Interactive widget to show/hide content.
Enable a responsive images solution by providing the browser multiple resources in varying resolutions for a single image.

name: <picture> Element
summary: Enable a responsive images solution by declaring multiple resources for an image using CSS media queries.

name: <template> Element
summary: HTML template element to allow creating fragment of inert HTML as a prototype for stamping out DOM.

name: a[download] attribute
summary: When used on an <a>, this attribute signifies that the resource it points to should be downloaded by the browser rather than navigating to it.

name: Application Cache
summary: Enables web pages to work without the user being connected to the internet

name: Audio tracks
summary: Adds the ability to get information about multiple audio tracks, and switch between them using the AudioTrack.enabled attributes.

name: Video tracks
summary: Adds the ability to get information about multiple video tracks, and switch between them using the VideoTrack.selected attributes.

name: Blob
summary: Allows you to construct Blobs directly (var blob = new Blob(["1234"], {type: 'text/plain'})). Blob() constructor also can take ArrayBufferView directly rather than constructing a blob with ArrayBuffer.

name: Block bindings (let, const, function)
summary: Allows developers to explicitly qualify access to variables within a block.

name: Canvas
summary: Provides an API to draw 2D graphics

name: Canvas focus ring
summary: Adds APIs to the canvas 2D context that make it possible to draw a focus ring around a canvas path and notify the operating system of the bounding box of the focused object for accessibility.

name: Compositing and Blending in Canvas 2D
summary: The canvas 2d context has the globalCompositeOperation attribute that is used to set the current compositing and blending operator.

name: Content Security Policy
summary: Allows you to create an allow list of sources of trusted content, and instructs the browser to only execute or render resources from those sources.

name: CSS calc()
summary: Method of allowing calculated values for length units, i.e. width: calc(100% - 3em)

name: CSS Device Adaptation
summary: The @viewport rule, in combination with media queries, enabled web developers to optimize the layout of sites and apps for different devices with minimal effort. It generalizes the viewport meta tag to CSS, while being much simpler to understand and without the quirks that exists with the meta tag.

name: CSS touch-action
summary: New CSS property to enable websites to declaratively state how touches should be handled for purposes of scrolling and zooming.

name: CSS Variables
summary: Introduces cascading variables as a new primitive value type that is accepted by all CSS properties, and custom properties for defining them.

name: CSS Will Change
summary: Adds a will-change CSS property, that can be used to signal that a particular property is likely to be changed in the future, or that an element's content is likely to change.

name: CSSOM View smooth scroll API
summary: Adds an optional argument to existing scroll APIs that specifies whether scrolling should be smooth. Also adds a CSS property for this.

name: Custom Elements
summary: Method for registering (creating) custom elements in script.

name: Device Motion
summary: Provides access to device's physical motion.

name: Device Orientation
summary: Provides access to device's physical orientation

name: devicePixelRatio on zoom
summary: Update window.devicePixelRatio on full page zoom so that it accurately portrays the ratio between css and device pixels.

name: DOM3 Keyboard Events
summary: KeyboardEvent: keydown, keyup, keypress

name: DOM3 mouseenter & mouseleave Events
summary: DOM event analog of CSS :hover psuedo-selector that fires as the mouse enters and exits the bounding box of an element (including its children).

name: DOM3 Wheel Events
summary: Implementation of the standard DOM Level 3 WheelEvent for mouse wheel rotation.

name: Drag and Drop Directories
summary: Allows dragging and dropping entire folders using HTML5 Drag and Drop. Extends the DataTransferItem with a method to get a FileEntry/DirectoryEntry.

name: Encrypted Media Extensions
summary: Defines a common API that may be used to discover, select and interact with such systems as well as with simpler content encryption systems.

name: Exclusions
summary: Define areas inline content should avoid, and how inline content should wrap around them.

name: Filters
summary: Apply (SVG-like) filter effects to arbitrary DOM elements.

name: Flexbox
summary: A CSS box model optimized for user interface design. The children of a flex container can be laid out in any direction and can "flex" their sizes to fill unused space and  avoid overflowing the parent.

name: Fullscreen API
summary: Programmatically instruct content on the page to be presented in the browser's full screen (kiosk) mode.

name: GamePad API
summary: Gives JS access to a game controller via USB.

name: Generated Content for Paged Media
summary: CSS properties helpful for printed publication.

name: Geolocation
summary: Provides access to device's physical location

name: Media Capture and Streams
summary: Provides access to the user's local audio and video input/output devices (getUserMedia API).

name: Gradients
summary: Gradients provide a method to, over a customizable amount of space, transition from one color to another.

name: Grid
summary: A two-dimensional grid-based layout system, optimized for user interface design.

name: HTML Imports
summary: Import HTML documents into other HTML documents.

name: HTTP Client Hints
summary: Header for proactive content negotiation; just as the Accept header allowed clients to indicate what formats they prefer, Client Hints allow clients to indicate a list of device and agent specific preferences.

name: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS)
summary: Header to inform the browser to always request a given domain over SSL, reducing MITM attack surface area.

name: SPDY/3
summary: A faster protocol for transporting web content.

name: HTTP/2
summary: A faster protocol for transporting web content being standardized by the IETF.

name: iframe[sandbox] attribute
summary: Method of running external site pages with reduced privileges (i.e. no JavaScript) in iframes (<iframe sandbox="allow-same-origin allow-forms" src="..."></iframe>)

name: iframe[seamless] attribute
summary: The seamless attribute is used to embed an <iframe> in the calling page without scrollbars or borders (e.g. seamlessly) and with the parent document's styles applying to the embedded seamless iframe.

name: iframe[srcdoc] attribute
summary: Gives the content of an iframe as a src context to embed (e.g. ).

name: IME API
summary: Provides Web applications with scripted access to an IME (input-method editor) .

name: IndexedDB
summary: An asynchronous client-side storage API offering fast access to large amounts of structured data

name: WebGL Instancing Extension
summary: A way to use the GPU to quickly draw a lot of copies of a single object. In some scenes (like a forest with a lot of trees) it is a great way to get a huge performance improvement. Requires a compatible GPU.

name: Map
summary: Map objects are simple key/value maps.

name: Masks
summary: Allows hiding of portions of a visible elements.

name: matchMedia
summary: API for testing if a given media query will apply.

name: MathML
summary: An application of XML for describing mathematical notations and capturing both its structure and content.

name: Media Queries: resolution feature
summary: Allows to query the device pixel count per CSS unit

name: Media Source Extensions
summary: Allows appending data to an <audio>/<video> element.

name: MediaRecorder
summary: Encode audio and video streams in the browser.

name: Microdata
summary: Microdata is used to nest semantics within existing content on web pages.

name: CSS Transforms - preserve-3d
summary: Augments existing CSS 3d transforms by facilitating the construction of complex 3d scenes.

name: mix-blend-mode
summary: Provides a way to blend an HTML or SVG element with its backdrop

name: Cross-Domain Font Loading
summary: Increases interoperability with the web by relaxing domain and licensing metadata restrictions for EOT, WOFF, and TrueType fonts.

name: Multi-column (full support)
summary: Allows content to be flowed into multiple columns with a gap and a rule between them using CSS.

name: Mutation Observers
summary: Provides notifications when DOM nodes are rearranged or modified.

name: Navigation Timing API
summary: Allows web applications to access timing information related to navigation and elements.

name: Page Visibility API
summary: Provides an API to ask whether the current tab is visible or not. If so, you might want to throttle back action or set an idle state.

name: Pointer Events
summary: Unified pointer input API (e.g. mouse, pen, touch input) which addresses several existing problems (especially on touchscreen laptops) and provides future extensibility.

name: Pointer Lock (Mouse Lock)
summary: Gives access to raw mouse movement, locks the target of mouse events to a single element, eliminates limits of how far mouse movement can go in a single direction, and removes the cursor from view. Obvious use cases are for first person or real time strategy games.

name: position: sticky
summary: position: sticky is a new way to position elements and is conceptually similar to position: fixed. The difference is that a stickily positioned element behaves like position: relative within its parent, until a given offset threshold is met.

name: postMessage
summary: Safely enables cross-origin communication.

name: Quota Management API
summary: This API can be used to check how much quota an app/origin is using.

name: Regions
summary: Magazine-like content flow into specified regions.

name: requestAnimationFrame()
summary: Offload animation repainting to browser for optimized performance. You should call this method whenever you're ready to update your animation onscreen. This will request that your animation function be called before the browser performs the next repaint.

name: Resource Timing API
summary: Allows web applications to access timing information related to HTML elements.

name: Service Worker
summary: ServiceWorkers (formerly Navigation Controllers) are a new system that provides event-driven scripts that run independent of web pages. They are similar to SharedWorkers except that their lifetime is different and they have access to domain-wide events such as network fetches.

name: Set
summary: Set objects let you store unique values of any type, whether primitive values or object references.

name: Streams API
summary: An API for representing binary data in web applications as a Stream object.

name: Subpixel font scaling
summary: Allow sub-css-pixel font-sizes and thus smooth font scaling.

name: SVG2
summary: Implement the new SVG2 features.

name: TLS 1.2
summary: The latest version of the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol. Allows for data/message confidentiality, and message authentication codes for message integrity and as a by-product message authentication.

name: Track element
summary: Add subtitles, captions, screen reader descriptions, chapters and other types of timed metadata to video and audio.

name: Transforms
summary: Enables changing the position of content in 3D space without disrupting the normal flow. See also preserve-3d.

name: Typed Arrays
summary: Buffers for holding binary data and working with WebGL & Audio API: ArrayBuffer, Float32Array , Int16Array, Uint8Array, etc.)

name: UIEvents - Keyboard Query APIs
summary: Identify the physical key being pressed; Query key from layout.

name: URL API
summary: Expose constructible URL objects that can be manipulated and combined.

name: User Timing API
summary: Helps web developers measure the performance of their applications by giving them access to high precision timestamps.

name: Vibration API
summary: This specification defines an API that provides access to the vibration mechanism of the hosting device. Vibration is a form of tactile feedback.

name: WeakMap
summary: WeakMaps are key/value maps in which keys are objects.

name: Web Animations JavaScript API
summary: A unified model for supporting animation and synchronization on the Web platform.

name: Web Crypto API
summary: JavaScript bindings for cryptographic operations. Note: we are looking to update our current implementation to the latest W3C Last Call Working Draft specification.

name: Web MIDI API
summary: Defines an API supporting the MIDI protocol, enabling web applications to enumerate and select MIDI input and output devices on the client system and send and receive MIDI messages.

name: Web Notifications
summary: An API for displaying simple notifications to the user.

name: Web Speech API (input)
summary: Enables web developers to incorporate speech recognition into their web pages.

name: Web Speech API (synthesis)
summary: Enables web developers to incorporate speech synthesis into their web pages.

name: Web SQL Database
summary: API exposing an SQLite database

name: Web Storage
summary: Refers to both localStorage and sessionStorage

name: WebGL  (Canvas 3D)
summary: 3D rendering via the <canvas> element.

name: WebP image format support
summary: WebP is an image format that provides lossless and lossy compression for images on the web.

name: WebRTC – WebRTC v1.0 API
summary: Real-time communication in the browser. See also "Web RTC - Object RTC API".

name: WebRTC – Object RTC API
summary: Enables mobile endpoints to talk to servers and web browsers with Real-Time Communications (RTC) capabilities via native and simple JavaScript APIs

name: WebSocket
summary: The WebSockets JavaScript API provides a simple API for bi-directional communication with web servers. The WebSocket network protocol enables low overhead bi-directional communication with web servers over a persistent TCP connection.

name: XMLHttpRequest timeout
summary: Exposing the XHR timeout property and sending corresponding events such as ontimeout.

name: Arrow function
summary: The arrow (=>) provides a shorthand for the function keyword with lexical 'this' binding.

name: Box Alignment
summary: CSS properties for aligning boxes within their container. Allows for true vertical centering among other features.

name: CSS filter() image function
summary: The function allows filtering an CSS input image with a set of filter functions. The used filter functions are the same as for the CSS filter property. The filter() function can be animated as well.

name: Default parameter
summary: Allows formal parameters to be initialized with default values if no value is passed.

name: Destructuring
summary: Destructuring assignment allows extracting data from arrays or objects using a syntax that mirrors array and object literals.

name: Rest parameters
summary: Allows representation of an indefinite number of arguments as an array.

name: Ambient Light Events
summary: Ambient Light Event API which is a handy way to make a web page or web app aware of any change in light intensity.

name: Battery Status API
summary: Allows access to see the battery level of the device's battery

name: Push API
summary: Provides webapps with scripted access to server-sent notifications.

name: Subresource Integrity
summary: Subresource Integrity defines a mechanism by which user agents may verify that a fetched resource has been delivered without unexpected manipulation. In a nutshell, metadata inlined into HTML elements allows the browser to determine whether the resource that was downloaded matches the resource the page's author expected to download.

name: CSS Intrinsic Sizing
summary: Extends the CSS sizing properties with keywords that represent content-based "intrinsic" sizes and context-based "extrinsic" sizes, allowing CSS to more easily describe boxes that fit their content or fit into a particular layout context.

name: CSS font-stretch
summary: Add support for the CSS font-stretch property.

name: Canvas2D text decoration
summary: Add a textDecoration attribute to canvas 2D contexts, behavior similar to existing "font" attribute: It's a DOMString, parsed the same way as corresponding CSS property (text-decoration).

name: JS iterators (i.e. the for-of feature)
summary: Iterates over iterable objects (including arrays, array-like objects, iterators and generators), invoking a custom iteration hook with statements to be executed for the value of each distinct property.

name: Navigation Error Logging
summary: This specification defines an interface to store and retrieve error data related to the previous navigations of a document.

name: Shapes
summary: Define arbitrary shapes inside and around which inline content can flow.

name: Symbols
summary: Allows properties to be added to existing objects without the possibility of interference with the existing properties, unintended visibility, or with other uncoordinated additions by any other code.

name: WebGL Shared Resources
summary: Allow sharing resources between 2 or more WebGL contexts

name: inputmode
summary: The inputmode content attribute is an enumerated attribute that specifies what kind of input mechanism would be most helpful for users entering content into the form control.

name: Object.observe()
summary: Observe changes to JS objects.

name: Shadow DOM (unprefixed)
summary: Enables DOM tree encapsulation. Without it, widgets may inadvertently break pages by using conflicting CSS selectors, class or id names, or JavaScript variables.

name: Web Audio API
summary: A high-level JavaScript API for processing and synthesizing audio in web applications

name: object-fit and object-position
summary: CSS properties that control the position and size of replaced content within the content box

name: Conditional Rules
summary: Support for the @supports at-rule and the "window.CSS.supports()" API

name: Generators
summary: A generator is a special type of function that works as a factory for iterators.

name: Custom filters (shaders)
summary: Filter effects are a way of processing an element’s rendering before it is displayed in the document.

name: High Resolution Time
summary: Enables reliable, high-resolution timing of client-side performance.

name: Scoped Styles
summary: Boolean attribute for the <style> element (<style scoped>). When present, its styles only apply to the parent element.

name: Proxies
summary: Proxies are objects for which the programmer has to define the semantics in JavaScript.

name: Touch Events
summary: Touchscreen input API, originally introduced by Apple on iOS

name: Runtime error reporting: ErrorEvent.
summary: Unhandled exceptions trigger the 'window.onerror' callback (or 'self.onerror' inside Workers) for centralized handling.

name: FileWriter
summary: Enables writing to files from web applications.

name: FileReader
summary: The FileReader object lets web applications asynchronously read the contents of files (or raw data buffers) stored on the user's computer, using File or Blob objects to specify the file or data to read.

name: Server-Sent Events (EventSource)
summary: Enables push notifications from the server received as DOM events.

name: Message Channels
summary: A messaging system that allows documents to communicate with each other regardless of their source domain, in a way designed to avoid cross-site scripting attacks.

name: Efficient Script Yielding - setImmediate()
summary: Allows web applications to flush the browser event queue and receive an immediate callback.

name: Resource Priorities
summary: Defines a means for site developers to programmatically give the User Agent hints on the download priority of a resource.

name: Beacon
summary: Enables web applications to asynchronously transfer data from the user agent to a web server, with the user agent taking the responsibility to eventually send the data.

name: Prefetch attribute
summary: Indicates the browser should preemptively fetch and cache the specified resource.

name: Prerender attribute
summary: Provides a hint to the browser that another page is likely to be loaded by the user (such as the first result of a search) such that it may be prerendered for better performance.

name: CSS Scrolling Snap Points
summary: Enables rich, customizable, and performant scrolling experiences like pagination of carousels by using snap points that enforce the scroll offsets that a scroll container may end at after a scrolling operation has completed.

name: DOM Level 3 XPath
summary: Provides simple functionalities to access a DOM tree using the XPath syntax.

name: Screen Orientation API
summary: Provides the ability to read the screen orientation state, to be informed when this state changes, and to be able to lock the screen orientation to a specific state.

name: CSS pointer-events
summary: Enables control of whether an element can receive input events from a pointing device using an API similar to the existing pointer-events property from SVG.

name: ES6 Array, Math, Number and String methods
summary: Adds a set of new Array, Math, Number and String helper methods.

name: WebDriver
summary: A platform and language-neutral interface and associated wire protocol that allows programs or scripts to introspect into, and control the behaviour of, a web browser.

name: SVG foreignobject element
summary: Allows for inclusion of a foreign namespace (such as HTML) which has its graphical content drawn by a different user agent

name: Media Queries Level 4: Interaction Media Features (pointer and hover)
summary: Allows to query the presence and accuracy of the user's pointing input (e.g. for differentiating touch versus mouse). Additionally, allows the page to query whether the user's pointing input supports hover.

name: Selection API
summary: Based on APIs from HTML5 and DOM Range, this specification includes additional methods for programmatically inspecting and modifying the selection.

name: ES6 Object Literal Enhancements
summary: Adds computed properties, concise method definitions, and short-hand for properties whose value is initialized to a same-named variable.

name: Promises (ES6)
summary: Allows easier and cleaner asynchronous coding. Adds the Promise constructor, along with the 'all' and 'race' utility methods to the language itself.

name: Karaoke Web Standard
summary: Provides semantic language processing for two-way communication with a remote host. This new interface creates a system-to-system forced sonic recognition on the receiving party.

name: SVG External Content
summary: Allows referencing external content in SVG. A common use case for this would be <use xlink:href="lib.svg#template" fill="#000000"></use>
